title: FAKE NEWS: Fox News spox says Shepard Smith was not escorted out by security
text:
According to NBC News’ Jo Link Kent, Shepard Smith’s departure was a surprise to many of his colleagues and he was even “escorted out by security”:

Sources directly familiar tell me many Fox News and Fox Business staffers were "shocked" when Shep Smith announced his departure on @foxnews, some were visibly upset. He was escorted out by security, per sources. Fox plans to have a set of rotating anchors host his time slot. https://t.co/FfW2QUNaoD — Jo Ling Kent (@jolingkent) October 11, 2019

But a Fox News spokesperson is denying that was the case:

5. From a Fox News spokesperson: “Shep’s exit from the building was planned and executed by Shep with Fox’s complete approval and the full support of FOX News – he was not remotely escorted out.” — Yashar Ali 🐘 (@yashar) October 11, 2019

A Fox News spokesperson tells me that Shepard Smith was NOT escorted out by security. https://t.co/sH74Y5Aozw — Jeremy Barr (@jeremymbarr) October 11, 2019

But it does seem true that Shep’s colleagues were blindsided by the news. Here’s Bret Baier:

I first worked with Shep on my first assignment at @FoxNews almost 23 years ago. It was a total shock today to find out he’s leaving. He anchored breaking news -fast-moving events —better than anyone. I wish him well in whatever lies ahead — Bret Baier (@BretBaier) October 11, 2019

And here’s Neil Cavuto’s on-air reaction along with reporter John Roberts:

Neil Cavuto and John Roberts clearly blind-sided by Shep Smith departure pic.twitter.com/36ijhC8th6 — Nicole Lafond (@Nicole_Lafond) October 11, 2019
